title: NEUE GALERIE - sans serif - font ID
content:
Looking for an ID on this beautiful sans serif. Any help or suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

many thanks,  
Danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124232059im_/http:/typophile.com/files/654b41ccd8e0e20ce8614b85993738c0_5947.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [654b41ccd8e0e20ce8614b85993738c0.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124232059/http:/typophile.com/files/654b41ccd8e0e20ce8614b85993738c0.jpg) | 14.96 KB |
author: Danny_Miller

comments.content:
Didn’t find any match for the entire set of letters.

The I searched on everything except the |A| and |R|, and found a very good match to Gotham:  
 [http://www.typography.com/fonts/gotham/styles/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124232059/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/gotham/styles/ "http://www.typography.com/fonts/gotham/styles/")

Mr. Eaves Sans by Emigre has a similar |R| (albeit with a much taller counter):  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/mr-eaves-sans-opentype/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124232059/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/mr-eaves-sans-opentype/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/mr-eaves-sans-opentype/")

Found a similar |A| in the free typeface Nottke:  
 [http://www.dafont.com/nottke.font?text=NEUE+GALLERIE](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124232059/http:/www.dafont.com/nottke.font?text=NEUE+GALLERIE "http://www.dafont.com/nottke.font?text=NEUE+GALLERIE")

It appears to be student work by Yooin Chu at the School of Visual Arts. Maybe custom (based on Gotham):  
 [http://www.graphis.com/entry/5bddd910-4b30-11e2-a2c9-f23c91dffdec/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124232059/http:/www.graphis.com/entry/5bddd910-4b30-11e2-a2c9-f23c91dffdec/ "http://www.graphis.com/entry/5bddd910-4b30-11e2-a2c9-f23c91dffdec/")

You can achieve a very close result with [http://www.g-type.com/houschka-pro-font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150124232059/http:/www.g-type.com/houschka-pro-font "http://www.g-type.com/houschka-pro-font") using the alternate |R| and shaving |G|'s beard.
